column1: @celtics I kept watching the @Celtics during the bad years (90’s) because he made that specific game interesting regardless of the standings. He so wanted the best version of the C’s regardless of record.

It won’t be the same to turn on the @Celtics this winter and not hear Tommy on the broadcast complaining about the officials. My thoughts and prayers go out to his family and his extended Celtics family. Rest In Peace Tommy.”
It’s hard to think about #Celtics basketball without Tommy Heinsohn. Tommy personified Celtics basketball reaching the greatest heights as both a player and a coach.

We are facing tough days ahead but President-electJoe Biden and VP-elect Kamala Harris know that there is no challenge or obstacle that America can't overcome by working together. Let the healing begin.
Vice President-elect Harris will make history as our first female Vice President our first Black Vice President and our first South Asian American Vice President.

There will be no sigh of relief until noon on 1/20/21 but knowing that we will have an American President who is compassionate and will fight for all of us - regardless of who you voted for - should give us all the strength to move forward with our heads held high.
Today democracy has won and the American people have won.
Finally. President-elect @JoeBiden and Vice President-elect @KamalaHarris. #mapoli https://t.co/lyELF2EMa7
Joe Biden is a healer - and when the counting is finished he will be an American President. #mapoli https://t.co/fR8FUbEUYc

As we continue toward determining the winner in remaining states it’s important to say thank you to those who have extended their public service by working to count every outstanding ballot. D/R/ind are working side by side to ensure that our democratic principals are honored.
This is a sad night for America. I condemn the President’s efforts to sow doubt and cause confusion surrounding this election and all elected officials regardless of party must do the same. #mapoli

Donald Trump is savaging democracy and he is savaging the rule of law. He wants to stop counting the votes - but if we stopped right now he would lose. What he actually wants is for states to stop counting votes for his opponent. #mapoli

Finally yesterday's election did not end the pandemic nor the current session of Congress - the Senate must take immediate action in the lame-duck session to put relief into the hands of Americans suffering from the impacts of this pandemic.

I am not celebrating yet as the course of the 117th Congress and our country's future is so closely tied to the final results of the Presidential Election. Every single vote must be counted because voters decide who wins an election not candidates.

Thank you Southeastern Massachusetts! I am deeply humbled to have won the majority of votes so far in every town in the 9th Congressional District and I look forward to continuing to serve our neighbors and our communities in the United States Congress. #ma09 #mapoli https://t.co/zdyAnu19cX
@VincentJamieGr1 @JoeBiden @EdMarkey @Vote_Moran Thanks Jamie!

Still the post office has adapted and we continue to depend on it for so much - prescriptions military care packages the weekly local newspaper and yes during a pandemic our ballots - and there's nothing radical about that. #PostalService #SaveTheUSPS #ma09 #mapoli
In the age of the internet where I can text my kids and get a response seconds later it's hard to imagine waiting weeks for a letter. #postalservice #SaveTheUSPS

When he and my uncles were serving our nation during World War II - fighting an actual radical agenda - my grandmother waited at home for the daily mail delivery in the hopes of an update from her sons. I still treasure my copies of those V mail letters. #postalservice #ma09 https://t.co/n8dA2fn32J

Hearing that the @realDonaldTrump now thinks that the basic federal responsibility of keeping the @USPS  afloat is part of a radical left-wing agenda I couldn't help but wonder what my father and grandmother would think about those remarks. #postalservice #ma09 #mapoli
I’m all in for @JoeBiden  and @KamalaHarris this November - this truly is a battle for the soul of our nation. #mapoli https://t.co/hBGAfniDfR

In less than one week two of his discriminatory policies have been defeated in front of the Supreme Court. In 4.5 months the American people have a chance to defeat him and his bigoted policies at the ballot box. I've never looked more forward to a vote in my life.

President Trump and Stephen Miller attempted to end the program that President Obama instituted to protect hundreds of thousands of immigrants brought to US as children from deportation.  Trump failed.

Today's monumental Supreme Court decision was a victory for America and humanity. The Trump administration's cruel and vindictive policy towards DACA recipients has been rebuked by our nation's highest court. #ma09 #mapoli

Today marks five years since @realDonaldTrump came down his escalator - and I have faith that in less than five months the American people are going to send him right back up that escalator to his penthouse. #VoteBlue2020 #mapoli #ByeDon2020 #ma09 #Biden

In reflecting on this decades-long fight and considering the Supreme Court came to their decision by applying the Civil Rights Act of 1964 it seems fitting to close with MLK's words: "The arc of the moral universe is long but it bends toward justice.” #mapoli #ma09
Love wins equality wins and I will never waver in my support for our LGBTQ+ family.

Barney first introduced that bill to the legislature in 1973 - it took nearly two decades to become law in Massachusetts. But we won - and when that local Selectman put his name on the ballot to challenge me because I supported equality he barely received 25% of the vote.

When the local newspaper reached out to ask why I supported equality in the workplace I told them "I think people are entitled to do their jobs. That's a basic right" - and that still holds true today. https://t.co/vIr5RNI4Ug

My district bordered the district of the long-time leading opponent of the legislation Sen. Arthur Lewis and I had a local selectman threatening to run against me if I continued to support the march toward equality.

In 1987 I was the only State Senator in my region to support legislation championed by my friend @BarneyFrank that extended civil rights in the workplace (and in housing credit and public accommodations) to our LGBTQ+ neighbors.

Discrimination by employers against LGBTQ+ individuals in the workplace has been illegal in Mass since 1989 but until today's #SupremeCourt Ruling it was still legal to discriminate - and even terminate - #LGBTQ employees in 17 states because of who they are &who they love.

Over 100000 Americans dead in just over 120 days. 1 in 4 Americans have filed for unemployment. Our allies don’t trust us. Our enemies don’t respect us. Our cities are on fire.   @realDonaldTrump response? To retweet and retreat. https://t.co/2viZP4a4ip
